name: May Weekends at Scarborough Museum
description:
May is Museum Month at Scarborough Museum! Visitors are invited to consider the theme of “home” through hidden histories and narratives that shape our community, reflecting on the way that objects can hold memories and culture to connect us to places known and unknown.

Enjoy a refreshing drink and snack prepared on the museum’s historic stove, get creative with hands-on crafts, and learn about new perspectives and ways of imagining museum spaces, revealing histories, and memories that define what home can be.

From May 3rd - 31st, the museum will feature ReDress, a powerful art installation by waⁿdat utrihǫt and multidisciplinary artist Catherine Tàmmaro, in recognition of May 5th, the National Day of Awareness for Missing & Murdered Indigenous Women and Girls and 2SLGBTQI+ people (MMIWG2S).

name: Kensington Flea
description: Kensington Flea is back for the 2025 season, bringing the vibrant spirit of local entrepreneurship to the heart of Kensington Market every weekend. The market features an exciting lineup of independent artisans, small businesses, vintage curators & emerging designers — all coming together to celebrate the best of Toronto’s creative culture.

name: East End Kids Pride 2025
description:
Calling all East End rainbow families, friends, neighbours, and allies! You’re all invited to join East End Arts for the third annual East End Kids Pride Program & Celebration! The theme this year is "Magical Metamorphosis". Join us for these free art workshops:

1. May 3 - T-shirt Screen Printing with Jackie Lee
2. May 10 - Banner & Printmaking with Naz Rahbar
3. May 24 - Butterfly Puppet Making with Shadowland Theatre
